metadata.title: Mikrobiologischer LABORBERICHT
metadata.author: Labor Dr. Klein Dr. Schmitt GmbH
metadata.summary: Microbiological lab report for patient Valerie Lemken, showing urine culture and resistance results. Two bacterial strains were identified: Escherichia coli and Enterococcus faecalis, both at 100,000/ml. The report includes antibiotic susceptibility testing for various drugs, with results indicating sensitivity (S), resistance (R), or intermediate sensitivity (MS). Hemostasis test was negative. Report issued by Medizinisches Versorgungszentrum Labor Dr. Klein Dr. Schmitt GmbH.

metadata.title: Endbefundbericht Stoffwechsellabor
metadata.author: Dr. med. Mirjam Schweitzer-Martin
metadata.summary: This is a metabolic laboratory report from UniversitätsKlinikum Heidelberg for patient Valerie Lemken (born 22.09.2020), detailing urine organic acid analysis. Results show markedly elevated levels of Succinate, Uracil, Dihydrouracil, and 2-OH-Glutarate, suggesting possible bacterial contamination or mitochondrial energy metabolism disorder. The report recommends follow-up testing with preserved urine samples and precise quantification via isotope dilution.

issues: Duplicate copy operations for SRC004 and SRC003 both targeting 'Verwaltung/Behoerden/2022' with identical target name '2022-01-18 Inschrijving als niet-ingezetene in de Basisregistratie Personen - the.pdf' — may overwrite or conflict.

Duplicate copy operations for SRC008, SRC009, SRC010, SRC012, SRC034 all targeting 'Finanzen/Steuern/2024' with identical target name '2024-01-01 Prämienrechnung Verbundene Wohngebäude-Versicherung - Baloise.pdf' — high risk of overwrite.

Folder 'Verwaltung/Behoerden/2025' is created via 'create_folder', but it is not listed in existing folders — this is acceptable, but note that SRC001 copies into it immediately after creation, which is safe if execution is sequential.

SRC050 and SRC051 both copy files named '2022-07-28 Anmeldebestätigung.pdf' into different folders ('Verwaltung/Behoerden/2022' and 'Referenz/Korrespondenz/2022') — this is acceptable if intentional, but may indicate misclassification if the same document is being duplicated across categories.
